      • authenticateUsingTotp

        public AuthenticationResponse authenticateUsingTotp()
                                             throws VerigatorException
        Starts the authentication flow using TOTP via the Verigator mobile app. If the user does not have a device with the app installed, Verigator will automatically fall back to the SMS flow. After calling this method, the user will receive a push notification or an SMS (in case the app is not installed) with the pin code.
        Returns:
        AuthenticationResponse, getMethod() specifies which method was used: sms or totp (app)
        Throws:
        ResourceForbiddenException - if you do not have access to the specified service
        WrongCredentialsException - if you have specified the incorrect credentials
        VerigatorInternalError - if a server-side error occurs
        VerigatorException - if there is a connection error

      • authenticateUsingSMS

        public AuthenticationResponse authenticateUsingSMS()
                                            throws VerigatorException
        Starts the authentication flow using SMS. After calling this method, the user will receive an SMS with the pin code.
        Returns:
        AuthenticationResponse, getMethod() specifies which method was used: sms or totp (app)
        Throws:
        ResourceForbiddenException - if you do not have access to the specified service
        WrongCredentialsException - if you have specified the incorrect credentials
        VerigatorInternalError - if a server-side error occurs
        VerigatorException - if there is a connection error

      • verifyPin

        public VerificationResponse verifyPin(java.lang.String pin)
                               throws VerigatorException
        Verifies the user-provided PIN against Verigator service
        Parameters:
        pin - the pin code that the user provided in your service
        Returns:
        VerificationResponse which indicates whether the PIN was correct or not (isVerified() method)
        Throws:
        ResourceForbiddenException - if you do not have access to the specified service
        WrongCredentialsException - if you have specified the incorrect credentials
        VerigatorInternalError - if a server-side error occurs
        VerigatorException - if there is a connection error

        public void setService(Service service)
